36.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

36.brief: how much, how great, how many
36.long: how much, how great, how many, as great as, as much.

36.brief: but, on the other hand, and
36.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

36.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
36.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
I give a commission (instructions), order; I admonish, prohibit.

36.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
36.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
more, greater, excessive, abundant, exceedingly, vehemently; noun: preeminence, advantage.

37.long: I strike with panic or shock; I amaze, astonish.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

37.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
37.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.
I hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported.
unable to speak or articulate; speechless.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.
